skills.title: Front-End
skills.description: I am proficient in front-end development, utilizing frameworks like Vue.js and React to create responsive and dynamic user interfaces. My skills in HTML and CSS ensure that I can craft visually appealing layouts that are both functional and accessible across different devices and platforms. These technologies allow me to effectively translate design concepts into fully functional and user-friendly web applications.

skills.title: Back-End
skills.description: I have strong backend development skills, primarily using Spring Boot and Go. With Spring Boot, I excel in building robust, scalable microservices and RESTful APIs, enhancing application functionality and server-side logic. My experience with Go adds to my capability in creating efficient, concurrent server applications that perform well under high loads. These skills enable me to ensure smooth data transactions and integrate various services seamlessly into comprehensive backend solutions.

skills.title: Q+A and Testing
skills.description: I also have experience in manual testing, utilizing tools like Jira Xray to create and execute test cases effectively. This hands-on approach allows me to thoroughly validate software functionality, identify potential issues, and ensure that all aspects of the application meet quality standards. Combining manual testing with automated approaches like TestCafe provides comprehensive coverage, enabling me to deliver robust and reliable software solutions.

skills.title: Technical Writing
skills.description: I have strong technical writing skills, supported by practical experience and formal education. I've contributed to professional reports, like the one for the Ocean Networks Canada Problem Solution Project, demonstrating my ability to explain complex concepts clearly. Additionally, I've taken multiple technical writing classes, enhancing my ability to create well-structured and accessible documentation for diverse audiences.

portfolio.title: Apriori Algorithm: Functional Programming
portfolio.description: I built and Apriori Algorithm in SML that scans csv files and creates a dictionary of popular items above a given support threshold in a first pass of the data. Then in a second pass of the data another dictionary containing all the popular pairs above the given support threshold from the first pass is created. This is programmed using functional programming practices and completes large files in a reasonable amount of time. Fun fact is that it does not contain a single loop in the program! (support threshold is the minimum number of times an item must appear in the transactions to be added to the respected dictionary.

portfolio.title: Computer Graphics Scenes
portfolio.description: Using WebGL and Javascript I created some computer graphics scenes. The first is a basic scuba diver and fish, which just focuses on object composition, connected shapes/structures, and animating the shapes/structures using a timestamp and sin and/or cos functions. The second is 3 rabbits dancing around a fire. This time around I implemented textures and converted my ADS shader to a fragments shader for smoother lighting. Also animated the camera to move around the scene and also switch the lighing from Phong to Blinn-Phong lighting

portfolio.title: Ocean Networks Canada Requirements Engineering Final Report
portfolio.description: The Ocean Networks Canada Problem Solution Project involved developing theoretical solutions to real-world problems using principles of requirements engineering. The project focused on honing analytical and planning skills, highlighting the importance of initial stages of project development, effective teamwork, and problem-solving capabilities. Throughout the project, tasks included brainstorming, prototyping, creating UML diagrams, and writing professional reports for the solution at each milestone. The culmination of these efforts resulted in a well-received solution proposal.
